comments:
I installed eclipse+BIRT on a linux machine. After finishing the "New Report"
dialog, the msgbox 
"internal error: 
An SWT error occured.
You are recommended to exit the workbench.
Subsequent errors may happen and may terminate the workbench without warning.
See the .log file for more details.
"
occured. (no matter, which report type i've chosen)
then eclipse is closed and can't be restarted, unless i delete the .metadata.

The bug is similar to bug#86994, except the .log is different.

It is possibly due to the java 1.5.0 that is installed by root. i've installed a
new jdk1.4 into my ~/jdk1.4/, but the 1.5 seems to persist.
(also the 86994 bug is possibly because of jdk1.5, although ther's no
java.version= entry in this post)

i hope this is useful though.

Martin Ebner

Looks the SWT is not installed or not use the right version.

Could you please provide more information like eclipse/GEF/EMF/Jave version, OS 
version?
Thanks

(In reply to comment #1) > Looks the SWT is not installed or not use the right version. Yes. It was the swt version. I've installed mozilla 1.6 gtk2 according to SWT FAQ - browserlinux. This resolves the issue.
